name: New York - New York Hotel and Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 1 night March 16 as a quick getaway with the wife. We arrived at the hotel about 6 pm and there were only 2 clerks at the front desk, so it took some time to check in. I had reserved a Park Avenue room for about $80.00 and had requested a King bed and non smoking room. We were told the the only non smoking rooms available had 2 queen beds or they could give us a king bed in a smoking room, eventhough I had made my reservation a month before. The clerk's only response was that requests weren't guaranteed. She offered me a suite, but at an additional cost of $30.00 which ended up being an extra $47.00 with taxes and resort fee. I've never been denied a request such as a non smoking room and/or a king bed, but would expect an upgrade if they were unable to accomodate me. The room itself was clean but a bit aged. We were on the 26th floor so we didn't hear the roller coaster as others have mentioned. The atmosphere was fun, alot of action in the casino, a younger crowd. The restauarants are mostly fast food type with the exception of the steakhouse and a good Irish bar. I've been to Veas many times and just wanted to try NYNY. If you want a cheap mid week rate, this will do, but next time I'll pay a few extra bucks and stay at a higher end place. Its a solid 3 star.
reviews.title: OK, For the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our stay here was great! We had a room with a decent view of the strip, although the windows were a little grimy! The room was lovely, easy to get to, and the hotel had loads of great restaurants and bars on site.
reviews.title: Great location, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was just above the rollercoaster which was quite loud, but thankfully it stopped at around 11pm each night. We were in Vegas to have fun so we didn't spend loads of time in our room, so it wasn't too bad, but I'd try and get a room away from the rollercoaster next time!
reviews.title: Fun hotel, clean and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the NYNY in the first week of March for my husband's 40th birthday with a couple of friends. We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable, relaxed with a good range of facilities and food options and fairly well located on the Strip.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Park Avenue Deluxe Strip View room, and it was a really good sized room with two Queen Beds and a view across to the MGM Grand, Excalibur & the airport with the mountains beyond. No problems with noise from the airport and not too much noise from the strip or roller coaster!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bit worried when we booked this but hotel was clean and the rooms were suprisingly modern. We paid a little bit more and took advantage of an offer with a strip view room. The only downsides are that checking in was a nightmare. Tried 3 times to check in, but no room available. When we tried the 3rd time it was well after check in time and they were still fobbing us off but we insisted and eventually got a room.
reviews.title: Clean and Modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other annoying point was that there is no trolleys available to get luggage from your car. They'll help you once you are in the casino but by then you've hauled it for 10-15 minutes from the car park so there is little point givining it to someone else you're going to have to tip to move it.
reviews.title: Adequate but not excellemt..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a nice room - clean, modern, good facilities but would be nice to have a fridge.
reviews.title: Loved NYNY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reasonable location, and relatively fine hotel, but if you want to spend lots of time by the pool, note that it is shaded until 11am, and is quite cramped, with loud music and the roller coaster going by every few minutes. The casino is quite dark, and there was renovation work going on whilst we were there. The room was nice, we had a park view room, which was comfortable with no problems. When we checked out there was a very long queue, so would advise using key drop. All in all, ok for the money, but would recommend shopping around depending on what you're looking for. If you want to spend all day by the pool, perhaps consider a different hotel. Reasonable for the money paid.
reviews.title: Just alright...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at NYNY from 29 june for 7 nights with my boyfriend, we are 27 and 25, last yr we stayed at Mirage and my BF decided to stay here this year and we wasnt disappointed, although the Mirage was more luxurious, the ny ny was more geared for us, lots of facilites and entertainment venues.
reviews.title: Not happy
It's just a scam to get you there
reviews.text: I received a postcard from them for three free nights in a spa suite and was told one was available so I booked it. But when we arrived we were told we were downgraded to a lower room because there were other people (who were high rollers) that wanted that room. I told them how unfair that was and we were there for my birthday (which we were) and that we booked this trip based on these reservations(which we did). The room we were given was just mediocre and I never intend on staying there again. The TV went off and on and there was no coffee maker. MGM is much nicer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 2nd stay at NYNY and the experience was much better than the first. Upon check-in, we were told that a non-smoking room was unavailable. Noticing our disappointment, the clerk appointed us a corner Park Avenue room on the 39th floor and offered to move us the following day. Much to our surprise, the room did not smell heavily of smoke and the views of the strip were excellent. Room was large, quiet, and the bed was very comfortable therefore we elected to keep the room for the remainder of our stay.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay at NYNY

likes.liked: — Quiet floor with only about 10 rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Based on our past experience, I would recommend requesting a room far away from elevators and as close to the end of the hallway as possible.
reviews.title: Pretty disappointing
Great Theme Hotel for "Disney" type experience, but....
reviews.text: Il Fornaio has good breakfast and has reasonable prices for lunch and dinner. America restaurant is okay, nothing fancy, good for families with children. Lots of eateries that will allow for varying tastes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The NYNY hotel has a nice themed casino, but the room I got was rather sub-par. The pillows were lumpy, the bedding cheap and crappy - the room was no better quality than a Day's Inn or something along those lines. The elevators were scattered throughout the casino, so I had to walk all the way around the casino floor just to get to my elevator. Also, the TV was small and all the way across the room (the room was big, but for no reason). I tried to check out in the morning on the TV, but the service was unavailable, so I had to go downstairs and wait in line. If I went back to Vegas, I would try a different hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointed with the Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was our first time in Vegas and we were from England. We chose NY NY because of the balance of price and reviews on Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: NY - NY Vegas - Nice Stay - First Time In Vegas

likes.liked: — Good Value - Quality Hotel - Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a good choice.
reviews.title: Good time in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in the last week of June 2008, in a Park Avenue upgrade at $89.95 a night.
reviews.title: Had a great stay at NY, NY

likes.liked: — lots to do, good shopping, affordable family hotel
likes.disliked: — A bit of a walk to the rest of the strip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's a quick summary :-
reviews.title: SUPERB!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Plus points :-
reviews.title: Loved NYNY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Wonderful Time!!!! Going back in Feb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Comfortable Bed
reviews.title: A Good Hotel
GREAT HOTEL
reviews.text: Clean Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location
reviews.title: Nice but not the best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Plenty of choices for food
reviews.title: They don't honor their offers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Need a quick getaway from the hassle of work, the hotel offered a deal that I couldn't refuse. Upgraded room a couple of drinks and admission to the Spa all for $70 dollars. Not a bad deal! Checked in Tuesday before Thanksgiving, no lines was done in less than 10 minutes. Upgrade my room to a Park Avenue Deluxe which was very nice and clean. Dinner that night was at ESPN Sports Zone which had the basketball games on that I wanted. Ended up at the The Bar at Times Square witch was a blast listen dueling pianos. The next morning went down to the Fitness center and had a nice workout. Fitness Center is a bit small but had good equipment and some free wieghts. Men locker room was great and relaxing. Check out was a breeze. All and all this was a great deal to get away, would highly suggest this hotel for a short getaway.
reviews.title: Nice getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the New York New York from November 19 through November 23, 2006. Selected their Park Avenue special which included an automatic upgrade to a Park Avenue room in the Century Tower. Room was average size, maybe even a little on the small side, compared to other Vegas hotels I've stayed in... but very clean and comfortable. There was some noise from the rollercoaster, but not enough to bother me as it only operates until 10 p.m. and most people aren't in their rooms until late night.
reviews.title: Nice Stay at New York New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino/entertainment/restaurants are all great. The place has a great vibe - very active and loud, but very fun. The Big Apple Bar is a great place to chill out with your cocktail of choice and listen to the cover bands playing on a raised stage behind the bar. Nine Fine Irishmen is fun and the food is good. America (their 24 hour cafe) also has good food and adequate service levels.
reviews.title: This was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Get an MGM players card - use can use it a bunch of different casinos (NYNY, MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, MIrage, TI, among others).
reviews.title: Hated NYNY!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those not familiar with Vegas, the hotel is in a good location - directly across MGM Grand (which is beautiful inside - and huge). Across the other street is the Excalibur where you can catch a free tram down to Luxor or Mandalay Bay. Next door is the Monte Carlo which is a much quieter casino if you prefer that kind of enviornment.
reviews.title: Great stay and will return!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Booked a four night stay at New York New York, Arrived at hotel a little early, well 2.30pm, was told by check in room was not ready but....if we waited a bit longer we could have smoking rooms, slightly annoying as we had just had an 11 hour flight!.. our party said no to smoking rooms as we had booked non smoking, we had to wait another hour but was upgraded to park avenue rooms.

reviews.title: Thanksgiving Trip.......Great time had by all!!
reviews.text: Room was very nice, clean, view of the roller coaster, didn't hear any noice from roller coaster.

reviews.title: Will stay at NYNY Las Vegas again!
reviews.text: Staff were friendly.

reviews.title: Great stay at New York New York
reviews.text: Good location, went to MGM grand most mornings for breakfast as its just across the road.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Piano bar was great in our hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is our third stay at the NYNY and we haven't been disappointed at any time. We have upgraded to the Penthouse for a very reasonable extra cost which has been worth every penny. Every room we have stayed in (Broadway, Ziggurat Suite and Penthouse) has always been clean with functioning bathrooms and appliances. The queues for check in never take long and the staff at the desk are always helpful and polite. On our last trip the hotel helped out with providing wheelchair assistance and an extra bed brought up to the room. It is great to come back in and see the beds had been turned down whilst we were out enjoying the evening.
reviews.title: We keep coming back for good reason!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: There are great views (from every room) overlooking the MGM Grand and the Excalibur. The hotel is well positioned and all I can say to those people who want to be on top of the Bellagio and TI is 'stay there then!'. Car valet service is also top notch! Must see Zumanity which the hotel offers good package deals on.
reviews.title: Untrustworthy staff left poor impression of hotel after not even a day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All round good experiences. See you another time NYNY!
reviews.title: worst hotel experience ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The title says it all. It doesn't bode well for a vacation when an incident report has to be filed on the first day. We were able to check into the room early, as we arrived early, and it was ready. We left for 3 hours, from 11:30 AM-2:30 PM, and came back to find someone had been in the room who wasn't allowed. The way it could be told was the Do Not Disturb sign, which was on the inside of the door when we left, was missing, and there was a used Q-Tip sitting on the table, which definitely wasn't there when we first checked into the room. The housekeeping staff was still on the floor, as it was the time of day when service would be done. It made me very uneasy, as my laptop was left out when we had left the room, and there was other valuables and money in the room. Thankfully, all personal items were still there when we noticed someone had been there (it was the first thing we checked). I went to ask a maid for another Do Not Disturb sign, and she acted suspicious when I asked her for one, asking what room, and I said it was missing as I thought someone had been in the room while we were gone, she didn't say anything, I said a complaint would be filed, and she said something in Spanish to the maintenance man who was also there. Suspicious people. Another maid was asked, and at first she didn't say anything, then finally replied she didn't speak English. An incident report was filed, and both Yulesha at the front desk who took the initial complaint, and Sharon from security who had us file the report and then moved us to another room were both very nice. The room we had first was New Yorker Tower B, room 1026, we were moved to New Yorker Tower B, room 1216. This incident left a very poor first impression of the hotel.
reviews.title: Don"t Go To Gallaghers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (both original and one we moved to) were the one we booked, which was an upgraded one to a Park Avenue room, it was decent sized, two queen beds, a desk,TV in an armoire with dresser and closet built into it, small table with two chairs by the window. For an extra $15/night we could have upgraded to a Broadway room, which was 50 square feet bigger, or a Park Avenue room that had a strip view room. We didn't mind the room we had, so chose not to upgrade. The room rate wasn't high to begin with. The room cleanliness was alright, though the one wall had some odd stains on it, and the one corner had some dust on the floor, like it hadn't been vacuumed well.
reviews.title: Wrong end of the strip!
Okay, but Vegas has better...
reviews.text: Consistently to Vegas at least four times a year, we've stayed at most (if not all) of the major resorts on the Strip as well as many of the hotels downtown. We recently stayed at NY-NY due to a great casino rate we were offered, but I can only say it was okay. The location is terrible - Near the end of the Strip and seems pretty far away to me from anything of interest. The rooms are EXTREMELY basic - even TI, Harrahs, or Golden Nugget are better. Not many "nice" dining options - More of a fast food atmosphere. Not much shopping at all, and everything is quite a walk. For the money, stay at Mirage, TI, Harrahs, or Golden Nugget.

reviews.title: Ok but not great...would probably stay again
reviews.text: We stayed at NY, NY in December 2003 the week before Christmas. We stayed in a spa room in the Empire tower that we got on an awesome promotion over the internet. NY, NY is an ok hotel...it was pretty clean except for some nasty looking brownish black stuff on one of the window sills (looked like dried blood)...and the wallpaper above the windows was really falling off. The rest of the room was clean though.

reviews.title: Great if you like timeshare salespeople
reviews.text: The room was very spacious and the hot tub was great! One thing that bothered us was that noise from the hallway sounded almost like it was in the room and you could hear people in neighboring rooms...water running, muffled voices, tv, etc. I don't gamble but my husband lost more money in the NY, NY casino than at any other casino in Vegas. He won nothing there at all...playing primarily slots...so gamble at your own risk. Overall NY, NY was ok and we would probably stay there again, but we have stayed in much nicer accomodations.

reviews.title: NewYork NewYork
reviews.text: I thought this was a four star hotel. The room was nice and clean, but so are Super 8s. Had a nice view of the roof. Played in the consino for hours...PERKS?...no one even brought us drinks. The biggest complaint is they have timeshare salespeople by the elevators so you are harassed each time you atempt to go to or leave your room. HOW TACKY! Nice for kids, but if you are over 21 stay away.

reviews.title: Honeymoon in Vegas
reviews.text: Stayed here last October for 6 nights. Never been to Las Vegas and upon arriving at the hotel was absolutely amazed!! No queue for check in, very quick. Room was located in the last building which was a bit of a trek of a walk to the room - and although the room wasn't quite upto to what the website said - however was still good quality. Great location , amazing casino's , shops, cafe's etc in the actual hotel. Pool was Ok, jacuzzi baths were boiling hot!!! Lack of a bar around the pool though.Good location, breakfast Ok, but other places better. Did quick checkout by dropping room key and card into box, glad we did as queue to check out was enormous. Overall may stay there again but would definitely go back to Vegas- FANTASTIC!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Good- Spring Break package came with alot of nice coupons, free drinks, two for one shows and roller coaster, etc. Decent room rate. My kids loved the roller coaster, coney island arcade, sportscenter video games, small "cafes" that served as food court. Piano bar kept the place rocking. Pool was cold but hot tubs were nice but everything closed at 5pm. Location was great and alot happening on that end of the strip.
reviews.title: Great Vibe but basic rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad- Average room. For as exciting as the outside is, the room was not. Hole in bedspreads, thin towels, strange bathroom layout. Upgraded to Park Avenue room and wasn't impressed so not sure how bad the cheapest rooms would be. Old style tv. Resort fee didn't include much especially wi-fi. Confusing layout.....if you had a few drinks, I'm not sure how you would find your way back to your room as the halls are like a mouse maze. Elevators were super slow....think a few were not working.
reviews.title: Satisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We faced the roller coaster but weren't bothered by the noise. Also, we were at the end of the hall so not much "walk by" noise from hallway. Lots of noise by the pool.....roller coaster goes over head every few minutes, lots of street noise, etc. If I had young people in tow, I'd stay there again but if it was just my husband, I'd want more upscale and romantic.
reviews.title: Average.......casino has tvs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was me and boyfriend's 3rd time in Vegas. We wanted to try something a little fancier than what we've normally stayed at.
reviews.title: Great time;

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quite nice - inside. It has ovbiously been reno'd lately. Nice furniture, gorgeous bath. But our view was of the back of a building, looking down at a roof vent.
reviews.title: Good Value, Nothing Spectacular.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had not been to Vegas in 20+ years. We weren't sure where to stay. We read the reviews, and picked NewYork, NewYork. It was a very good choice.
reviews.title: first time to vegas in 20+ years

likes.liked: — atmosphere was fun+professional. quite a combination.
likes.disliked: — noise from the roller coaster. we heard it, on the 28th floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're 53, and we were joined by our 2 daughters, ages 21 and 24.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Perfect location. In the center of everything. We ate at the Deli, the main 24-hour restaurant, America, and at an Irish restaurant, Nine Irish Fishermen, all on site. Each meal was excellent, and well-priced.
reviews.title: Four 21 year old girls - we loved NYNY

likes.liked: — NYNY looks so cool on the outside - just like the NY skyine - awesome!
likes.disliked: — The dry air - but that was everywhere in vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What we found that we hadn't seen in ohter reviews:
reviews.title: Another nice stay at NYNY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Valet service and parking was free.
reviews.title: Viva Las Vegas!!!!
1st timers in LV
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from a 4 day trip to Las Vegas. It was our 1st time there and we had a wonderful experience!! We stayed at New York, NY Hotel. The rooms were nice, but found the casino smaller than some of them on the strip. The rooms were clean and the hotel staff were helpful! We'd go back to LV again!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2004, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Vegas. This hotel was so attractive. Felt like we were on a Disney themed property. Ck.- in was easy. Walk to elevator was long, but if you follow the outline on floor (like a sidewalk), you will not get lost. We had spacious jacuzzi suite and was done up in art deco style...not fancy but nice and very comfortable bed. No noise at all between walls. Bathroom was all marble in black, beige and white. Roller coaster outside was not bothersome at all. We loved the atmosphere at this hotel. Casino on ground floor has 3 story ceilings and you feel like you are in Central Park, with glittering trees all around you...very little smoke and not claustrophobic at all.
reviews.title: adorable hotel-great food 1-18-04 to 1-22-04
great stay
reviews.text: Noise factor was very low too. Restaurant food was very good. It was hard to decide where to eat. We saw the Zumanity Show one night and it was just fantastic. I liked the fact that you could step outside and take sky bridge over to MGM Hotel very easily. We ate buffet breakfast over there, since NYNY does not have a buffet. I think NYNY is a great hotel for younger people...has great night life and has great urban feel. Seniors will find lobby confusing when tryting to get to elevators and rooms. It can be a long walk from your elevator to your room in many cases. Other than that, I would recommend it to any one.

reviews.title: Fabulous stay! Want to go back!!
reviews.text: Great experience.

reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
reviews.text: stayed jan 15-18. requested rooms nearby as i was traveling with my ellderly parent. staff were very helpful put us in adjoining rooms.

reviews.title: Won't go back to stay!
reviews.text: Did like the airport check-in as had been warned about the long lines at the hotel, but was told our room was 5 door from elevator more like 5 halls away. Room was dark almost dinghy with only 3 drawers in dresser and a 15 inch TV NO coffee maker's which even Holiday Inn has!

reviews.title: Half-baked Big Apple
reviews.text: Hotel/Casino is noisy and is more like a Mall with little food booths crowded together No buffet so have to go elsewhere Food at America's dinner is so-so with service so so Rarely got our order right, complete or timely Bar staff WAS friendly and attentive Thanks Ray, Mike and Mary! Seems like this hotel caters more to the very young party crowd than others. I like these properties but will choose MGM Irage or Treasure Island

reviews.title: The New York Reality Experience
reviews.text: Staying at New York-New York is like getting this really neat package for your birthday that has elaborate wrapping and ribbons and bows, but when you open it up you find socks and underwear. Not fancy socks and underwear, either. Okay, I think the target market for New York-New York is probably under 25 and not looking for much in a hotel room other than a bed and bathtub. And that's about all the hotel offers, an uninspired room with no frills...no in-room coffee, no cable, no water pressure and (at least in my experience) limited housekeeping.

reviews.title: NY, NY is a terrible casino!!!
reviews.text: After the second night there, they neglected to make up the room. When I called at 6 p.m. to request service, they assured me it would be taken care of. When I returned from dinner and gambling at 10:30 p.m., it still hadn't been cleaned. I gave up and settled in for the evening.

reviews.title: Should be called Bay Area Bay area...
reviews.text: At a quarter to midnight housekeeping called and asked if I still wanted my room made up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the NYNY in April 2008, as a couple, based on reviews on this site and the look of the hotel. It was our first visit to Vegas and needless to say we weren't disappointed by it either.
reviews.title: Great Time, Great Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Pool was crowded and quite small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Cab from the airport was about $15 I think and less than ten minutes. Check in was superb, no-one in the queue and upgraded to a room with a strip view for $10 per night which was well worth it. It was a corner room looking out over MGM/Excaliber and the roller coaster (Which wasn't noisy).
reviews.title: Best USA Holiday ever by a mile, YEAH !!

likes.liked: — The ease of doing what you wanted, anything goes here
likes.disliked: — Those crazy loud people at 3 in the morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a good size (but with two queen size beds instead of a king) and was in good condition. The casino itself was be upgraded while we were there so some areas were out of bounds but was still a pretty good size.
reviews.title: Had better elsewhere in Vegas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurants in NYNY were excellent and everything that was needed was there. Nine fine Irishman was OK though a bit pricey for drinks. Bar at Times square was excellent and you don’t need to go in to sample the atmosphere. The roller coaster was excellent and could ride all day for a little over the cost of one ride ticket.
reviews.title: Exciting Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pool area was OK if a little cramped. They get as many loungers in as they can as long as you’re there relatively early (Opens at 10AM) then you’ll get a lounger but is very busy in the afternoon. Most of the pool was in the shade when it opened, when we were there, but that didn’t last long.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Never again
reviews.text: I go to Vegas a lot and get comp'd a lot. We've stayed at NyNy several tines but hadn't in the past two years due to loving MGM. Well this trip really was the worse. The beds were noisy, the pillows were a joke, the bathroom was forgetable. The noise from the roller coaster sucked and kept me up. I came home and the next day woke up with red itchy bumps on my legs! My dad had the worst of it! His were just times 10. So no more. I'm done with this place. I'll stick to the Bellagio or MGM.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I just got married on April 18, 2009 and since we live in FL we decided the ideal honeymoon location for us would be VEGAS! This was our first trip to Vegas and we booked our hotel and flight for a great price on Expedia.com, the person booking our trip recommended NY NY and we booked it. I have to admit when we arrived I was a little apprehensive as this was also my first time on a plane so I was exhausted and the wait at check in was a little longer than I had expected and when we arrived our room was not ready yet as we were early for check in. Went to lunch at the America restaurant and had a WONDERFUL patty melt and awesome fries. When our room was ready (we had a park avenue room) we walked in and my jaw dropped! I looked out from our window on the 24th floor and I could see the mountains, the roller coaster, the airport and the Excalibur hotel. I LOVED the view. The noise from the roller coaster didn't bother us as we are night owl and we are in our 20's. Casino was nice. Zumanity was great and we got a 2 for 1 special for staying at NY NY.
reviews.title: Trip to NYNY for our Honeymoon, LOVED THIS Hotel! DEF. going back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: COMPLAINTS: Ice machines were very slow and looked ragged, snack machine didn't work on multiple floors, hubby had to go three floors up to get something.
reviews.title: Start spreading the news....New York, New York is great for families!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010
reviews.text: as soon as we got to the counter to check in the lady left to go take her lunch and we had to wait longer.
reviews.title: Cool Hotel with alot of Character....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: INTERNET FEES AND CHARGES TO PRINT YOUR BOARDING PASSES!
reviews.title: Great time at NY NY
I would recommend this hotel if you get a good deal
reviews.text: This was my 5th trip to Las Vegas, 1st time staying at the New York New York.

reviews.title: I highly recomend NY NY
reviews.text: Checked in at the airport at 10:00am, room was not ready, but they reserved it for us and told us to pick up keys when we got to the hotel and the room should be fine. Got to the hotel, within 5 minutes had out keys and made it up to the room . Was on the 28th floor of the "Chrystler Tower" with a standard Skyline room. People have made comments about the size of the room, but for the two of us, there was not a size problem. It was a great room, with a western view. Extremely quiet, never had a noise problem. Will stay here again if the price is right.

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: New York,New York was fabulas. I will never stay anywhere else! Fun casino, wonderful atmosphere, clean room, and good service! You get a 20 on a 1 to 10 scale!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2004
reviews.text: It was a great stay. At night they had security to keep anyone who was not a guest out of the hotel part. Only bad thing was that the Century tower was very far from the elevator and the slots suck.
reviews.title: FABULOUS NEW YORK NEW YORK
New York, New York Hotel (Las Vegas ) New Years Eve
reviews.text: VIVA LAS VEGAS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this casino for three nights on an offer...3 comp nights, 2 for 1 tickets, 75 resort credit. Well...the room was ok but nothing spectacular, the 2 for 1 tickets had us running back and forth between the box office and player's club, and the 75 in resort credit??? Dunno where the hell this applied but they state its part of your package.
reviews.title: Great Location but lacks a bit...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel eateries were great, 24 hours a day, Irish pub was fantastic, casino was good to us but we did hear of other winning in the casino.
reviews.title: Nice, but not worth four stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Casino is for a younger crowd and the partying crowd, lotsof twenty-something kids who occupy tables and get really rowdy by midnight.
reviews.title: not great, just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a great place for a younger couple or singles.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for its price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location is excellent to walk to six nearby casinos, tickets for shows/attractions on the strip.
reviews.title: Ok Hotel, but Service was Terrible, and Pool was closed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at NY NY for a period of 5 days. It was not one of the best hotels we have sytayed at over many years travelling in the USA.
reviews.title: won,t be coming back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room whic we up graded too had a FOUL DRAIN SMELL IN THE BATH ROOM, WHICH WAS REPORTED on a few occassions to the hotel staff. the ventilation system in the bathroom DUMPED smoke fumes from the smoking rooms. this was verified by the maintenance engineer.The pool area was dirty, with the pool towels grey,& thread bare. Again the offending drain smell was evident.
reviews.title: Lovin' NY in Las Vegas

likes.liked: — Walking through the shopping feeling like I am in NY when in reality its Las Vegas
likes.disliked: — There was not buffet dining at the hotel, however there was great restaurants in the hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff in the American resteraunt were far from helpfull, but still looking for there tip.
reviews.title: Loved New York New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Venture outside on to the sidewalk, and get confronted by a group of Mexicans, Soliciting for Call Girls.
reviews.title: Reasonable Place to Stay on the Vegas Strip

likes.liked: — The location and proximity to other Vegas attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: This lowers the tone of the area, and shows this end of the Strip for what it is TACKY.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Most of the hotels in Vegas aren't famous for their rooms. It seems that all the hype is about the casino or roller coaster or other exciting amenities that the hotel has. Same for NY NY. The room (1 upgrade from the Skyline room) was "OK". As we were in the Empire State Building, the windows were small and it was a long trek to the room from the elevator (took us about 8 turns of hallways to get there!). The inside of the hotel itself was exciting. Not overly luxurious (like a Bellagio or Venetian) but had an exciting feel - perfect for families. I would definitely stay there again, especially since you can get much better rates at the NY NY. We rode the roller coaster, of course. What fun!
reviews.title: NY, NY Las Vegas is a Fun place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are okay, a bit small but clean and cozy. The main reason we stay at NYNY vs some other on the Strip is that parts of the casino and restaurants have different themes which the kids like to alternate their visits. The hotel is also conveniently located so you can walk around to other casinos.
reviews.title: Come here for the experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay. The room was very clean and comfortable. We loved the bed....very plush. We only stayed one night but will definitely choose New York New York on our return visit to Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: I have stayed here the last few trips I have made to Vegas. I have only stayed in the park avenue and broadway rooms so those are the only rooms I can recommend. I have never had any problems with any of the rooms including distance from elevator/check-in desk, cleanliness, comfort, or view.
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My bf and I always stay here together and most of our time is spent at the hotel. We are mid to late 20's, regarding age. We have stayed at Bally's and MGM but always found ourselves hanging out at NYNY. We sit at bars and play video poker while sipping comped drinks, the pizza is great, steak nachos at Gonzalez/Gonzalez are delicious!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked NYNY for my BF's birthday via NYNY's website using their "1st time email offer". Eventhough the hotel was overpriced for the month of stay (however the CES & AVN conventions were on that weekend), I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Would stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I posted an upgrade request on NYNY's Facebook page. I received a call from a staff member asking if I wanted to upgrade to a Spa Suite for an additional cost. Eventhough I declined that I was upgraded from a Skyline to a Park Avenue Suite at no charge.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we used the valet service, which was great! Unfortunately the hotel has a $14/night resort fee & the pool is closed for the season. There should be a discounted resort fee as some of the amentities are unusable. However, we were happy to find out that we had a strip view corner room on the 38th floor (also happened to be my BF's 38th birthday LOL)
reviews.title: Great time, fun casino, good dining options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room faced the MGM Grand. We also had views of the Excalibur, Tropicana. And out of the side windows we could see Monte Carlo & City Center.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Security staff came to our room promptly when the safe couldn't open. He asked for ID to make sure it was our room (which we were appreciative of).
reviews.title: Great NYE experience, with one exception

aka: New York - New York Hotel Las Vegas
